intro: Airampoa minuscula, commonly known as the small airampoa, is a low-growing, perennial plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its fine, tufted foliage and compact growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Airampoa minuscula is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
